trans-unit.source: Configure Load balancer TCP idle timeout | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure Load balancer TCP idle timeout | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Configure Load balancer TCP idle timeout
trans-unit.target: Configure Load balancer TCP idle timeout

trans-unit.source: How to change TCP idle timeout settings for load balancer
trans-unit.target: How to change TCP idle timeout settings for load balancer

trans-unit.source: In its default configuration, Azure Load Balancer has an ‘idle timeout’ setting of 4 minutes.
trans-unit.target: In its default configuration, Azure Load Balancer has an ‘idle timeout’ setting of 4 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This means that if you have a period of inactivity on your tcp or http sessions for more than the timeout value, there is no guarantee to have the connection maintained between the client and your service.
trans-unit.target: This means that if you have a period of inactivity on your tcp or http sessions for more than the timeout value, there is no guarantee to have the connection maintained between the client and your service.

trans-unit.source: When the connection is closed, your client application will get an error message like “The underlying connection was closed: A connection that was expected to be kept alive was closed by the server”.
trans-unit.target: When the connection is closed, your client application will get an error message like “The underlying connection was closed: A connection that was expected to be kept alive was closed by the server”.

trans-unit.source: A common practice to keep the connection active for a longer period is to use TCP Keep-alive (You can find .NET examples [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.servicepoint.settcpkeepalive.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: A common practice to keep the connection active for a longer period is to use TCP Keep-alive (You can find .NET examples [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.servicepoint.settcpkeepalive.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: Packets are sent when no activity is detected on the connection.
trans-unit.target: Packets are sent when no activity is detected on the connection.

trans-unit.source: By keeping on-going network activity, the idle timeout value is never hit and the connection is maintained for a long period.
trans-unit.target: By keeping on-going network activity, the idle timeout value is never hit and the connection is maintained for a long period.

trans-unit.source: The idea is to configure the TCP Keep-alive with an interval shorter than the default timeout setting to avoid having the connection dropped or increase the idle timeout value for the TCP connection session stay connected.
trans-unit.target: The idea is to configure the TCP Keep-alive with an interval shorter than the default timeout setting to avoid having the connection dropped or increase the idle timeout value for the TCP connection session stay connected.

trans-unit.source: While TCP Keep-alive works well for scenarios where battery is not a constraint, it is generally not a valid option for mobile applications.
trans-unit.target: While TCP Keep-alive works well for scenarios where battery is not a constraint, it is generally not a valid option for mobile applications.

trans-unit.source: Using TCP Keep-alive from a mobile application will likely drain the device battery faster.
trans-unit.target: Using TCP Keep-alive from a mobile application will likely drain the device battery faster.

trans-unit.source: To support such scenarios, we have added support for a configurable idle timeout.
trans-unit.target: To support such scenarios, we have added support for a configurable idle timeout.

trans-unit.source: You can now set it for a duration between 4 and 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: You can now set it for a duration between 4 and 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This setting works for inbound connections only.
trans-unit.target: This setting works for inbound connections only.

trans-unit.source: tcptimeout
trans-unit.target: tcptimeout

trans-unit.source: Configure TCP timeout to an endpoint on a Virtual Machine via PowerShell or Service Management API
trans-unit.target: Configure TCP timeout to an endpoint on a Virtual Machine via PowerShell or Service Management API

trans-unit.target: Configure TCP timeout for your Load-Balanced Endpoint Sets via PowerShell or Service Management API.

trans-unit.target: Configure TCP timeout for your Instance-Level Public IP

trans-unit.source: Configure TCP timeout for your Web/Worker roles via the service model.
trans-unit.target: Configure TCP timeout for your Web/Worker roles via the service model.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Keep in mind some commands will only exist in the latest Azure PowerShell package.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Keep in mind some commands will only exist in the latest Azure PowerShell package.

trans-unit.source: If the powershell command doesn't exist, download a latest PowerShell package.
trans-unit.target: If the powershell command doesn't exist, download a latest PowerShell package.

trans-unit.source: Configure TCP timeout for your Instance-Level Public IP to 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Configure TCP timeout for your Instance-Level Public IP to 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: IdleTimeoutInMinutes is optional.
trans-unit.target: IdleTimeoutInMinutes is optional.

trans-unit.source: If not set, the default timeout is 4 minutes.
trans-unit.target: If not set, the default timeout is 4 minutes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The acceptable timeout range is between 4 and 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The acceptable timeout range is between 4 and 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Changing timeout settings for cloud services
trans-unit.target: Changing timeout settings for cloud services

trans-unit.source: You can leverage the Azure SDK for .NET 2.4 to update your Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: You can leverage the Azure SDK for .NET 2.4 to update your Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: Endpoint settings for Cloud Services are made in the .csdef.
trans-unit.target: Endpoint settings for Cloud Services are made in the .csdef.

trans-unit.source: In order to update the TCP timeout for a Cloud Services deployment, a deployment upgrade is required.
trans-unit.target: In order to update the TCP timeout for a Cloud Services deployment, a deployment upgrade is required.

trans-unit.source: An exception is if the TCP timeout is only specified for a Public IP.
trans-unit.target: An exception is if the TCP timeout is only specified for a Public IP.

trans-unit.source: Public IP settings are in the .cscfg, and they can be updated through deployment update and upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Public IP settings are in the .cscfg, and they can be updated through deployment update and upgrade.
